metadata.title: Implement idle activation of screen saver
metadata.description: Idle activation of the screen saver should be enabled.

criterion.comment: gnome screensaver is activated on idle
gnome screensaver is activated on idle

metadata.title: Enable Auditing for Processes Which Start Prior to the Audit Daemon
metadata.description: Look for argument audit=1 in the kernel line in /boot/grub/grub.conf.

metadata.title: Ensure /var Located On Separate Partition
metadata.description: Ensuring that /var is mounted on its own partition enables the setting of more restrictive mount options, which is used as temporary storage by many program, particularly system services such as daemons. It is not uncommon for the /var directory to contain world-writable directories, installed by other software packages.

metadata.title: Service postfix Enabled
metadata.description: The postfix service should be enabled if possible.

criteria.comment: package postfix installed and service postfix is configured to start
service postfix is configured to start

metadata.title: Package postfix Installed
metadata.description: The RPM package postfix should be installed.

metadata.title: Service ntpd Enabled
metadata.description: The ntpd service should be enabled if possible.

metadata.description: The RPM package ntp should be installed.

metadata.title: Service qpidd Disabled

metadata.title: Disable IPv6 Kernel Module Functionality via Disable Option
metadata.description: The disable option will allow the IPv6 module to be inserted, but prevent address assignment and activation of the network stack.

criteria.comment: Check if ipv6 was disabled in /etc/sysctl.conf or in /etc/modprobe.d

criteria.comment: Make sure that the /etc/sysctl.conf file is configured correctly and the option is configured correctly in the running kernel using sysctl.

account required pam_faillock.so set in system-auth

pam_faillock.so authfail deny value set in password-auth
account required pam_faillock.so set in password-auth

metadata.title: Verify /etc/gshadow Permissions
metadata.description: This test makes sure that /etc/gshadow is owned by 0, group owned by 0, and has mode 0000. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL then it will fail the mode check.

metadata.title: Verify group who owns 'gshadow' file
metadata.description: The /etc/gshadow file should be owned by the appropriate group.

metadata.title: Disable dccp Kernel Module
metadata.description: The kernel module dccp should be disabled.

metadata.description: The avahi-daemon service should be disabled if possible.

metadata.description: Require samba clients which use smb.conf, such as smbclient, to use packet signing. A Samba client should only communicate with servers who can support SMB packet signing.

criterion.comment: check for client signing = mandatory in /etc/samba/smb.conf

metadata.title: Verify /var/log/audit Ownership
metadata.description: Checks that all /var/log/audit files and directories are owned by the root user and group.

metadata.description: This test makes sure that /etc/shadow is owned by 0, group owned by 0, and has mode 0000. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL then it will fail the mode check.

metadata.description: Configure the system to notify users of last logon/access using pam_lastlog.

metadata.title: File grub.conf Owned By root Group
metadata.description: The grub.conf file should be owned by the root group. By default, this file is located at /boot/grub/grub.conf or, for EFI systems, at /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.conf

metadata.title: Send Logs to a Remote Loghost
metadata.description: Syslog logs should be sent to a remote loghost

metadata.title: File grub.conf Owned By root User
metadata.description: The grub.conf file should be owned by the root user. By default, this file is located at /boot/grub/grub.conf or, for EFI systems, at /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.conf

metadata.title: Auditd Maximum Log File Size
metadata.description: max_log_file setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to at least a certain value

metadata.title: UID 0 Belongs Only To Root
metadata.description: Only the root account should be assigned a user id of 0.

criterion.comment: tests for reg exp ^[^r][^o][^o][^t].*:0 in /etc/passwd file

metadata.title: Ensure Yum gpgcheck Globally Activated
metadata.description: The gpgcheck option should be used to ensure that checking of an RPM package's signature always occurs prior to its installation.

metadata.title: Ensure /home Located On Separate Partition
metadata.description: If user home directories will be stored locally, create a separate partition for /home. If /home will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be configured later.

metadata.description: The kernel module usb-storage should be disabled.

metadata.description: All syslog log files should be owned by the appropriate user.

metadata.description: The /etc/passwd file should be owned by the appropriate group.

metadata.title: Set SHA512 Password Hashing Algorithm in /etc/libuser.conf

metadata.description: The /etc/gshadow file should be owned by the appropriate user.

metadata.description: The password lcredit should meet minimum requirements using pam_cracklib

metadata.description: Audit logs are stored in the /var/log/audit directory. Ensure that it has its own partition or logical volume. Make absolutely certain that it is large enough to store all audit logs that will be created by the auditing daemon.

metadata.title: Verify /etc/passwd Permissions
metadata.description: This test makes sure that /etc/passwd is owned by 0, group owned by 0, and has mode 0644. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL then it will fail the mode check.

metadata.title: Ensure /tmp Located On Separate Partition
metadata.description: The /tmp directory is a world-writable directory used for temporary file storage. Verify that it has its own partition or logical volume.

metadata.title: The system must require administrator action to unlock an account locked by excessive failed login attempts.
metadata.description: The number of allowed failed logins should be set correctly.

metadata.title: No nullok Option in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
metadata.description: The file /etc/pam.d/system-auth should not contain the nullok option

criterion.comment: make sure the nullok option is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth

metadata.title: Require Authentication for Single-User Mode
metadata.description: The requirement for a password to boot into single-user mode should be configured correctly.

metadata.title: Set ClientAliveCountMax for User Logins
metadata.description: The SSH ClientAliveCountMax should be set to an appropriate value (and dependencies are met)

criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

metadata.title: Disable Host-Based Authentication
metadata.description: SSH host-based authentication should be disabled.

criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

metadata.title: SELinux Enforcing
metadata.description: The SELinux state should be enforcing the local policy.

metadata.title: Set OpenSSH Idle Timeout Interval
metadata.description: The SSH idle timeout interval should be set to an appropriate value.

criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

metadata.title: Ensure gpgcheck Enabled For All Yum Package Repositories
metadata.description: Ensure all yum repositories utilize signature checking.

criteria.comment: ensure all yum repositories utilize signiature checking

criterion.comment: verify no gpgpcheck=0 present in /etc/yum.repos.d files

metadata.title: Disable .rhosts Files
metadata.description: Emulation of the rsh command through the ssh server should be disabled (and dependencies are met)

criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

metadata.title: Set Accounts to Expire Following Password Expiration
metadata.description: The accounts should be configured to expire automatically following password expiration.

criteria.comment: the value INACTIVE parameter should be set appropriately in /etc/default/useradd

metadata.title: Disable Core Dumps
metadata.description: Core dumps for all users should be disabled

metadata.title: Disable root Login via SSH
metadata.description: Root login via SSH should be disabled (and dependencies are met)

criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

metadata.title: Verify group who owns 'shadow' file
metadata.description: The /etc/shadow file should be owned by the appropriate group.

metadata.title: Enable a Warning Banner
metadata.description: SSH warning banner should be enabled (and dependencies are met)

criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

metadata.title: Do Not Allow Users to Set Environment Options
metadata.description: PermitUserEnvironment should be disabled

criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

metadata.title: Disable Interactive Boot
metadata.description: The ability for users to perform interactive startups should be disabled.

metadata.title: Disable Empty Passwords
metadata.description: Remote connections from accounts with empty passwords should be disabled (and dependencies are met)

criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

metadata.title: Verify user who owns 'shadow' file
metadata.description: The /etc/shadow file should be owned by the appropriate user.

metadata.title: The system must disable accounts after excessive login failures within a 15-minute interval.
metadata.description: The number of allowed failed logins should be set correctly.

metadata.title: Enable SELinux in /boot/grub/grub.conf
metadata.description: Check if selinux=0 OR enforcing=0 within /boot/grub/grub.conf lines, fail if found.

criterion.comment: check value selinux|enforcing=0 in /boot/grub/grub.conf, fail if found

metadata.title: Package GConf2 Installed
metadata.description: The RPM package GConf2 should be installed.

metadata.title: Package gdm Installed
metadata.description: The RPM package gdm should be installed.

metadata.title: Enable GUI Warning Banner
metadata.description: Enable the GUI warning banner.

metadata.title: The NFS server must not have the insecure file locking option enabled.
metadata.description: The NFS server must not have the insecure file locking option enabled.

metadata.title: The system must prohibit the reuse of passwords within five iterations.
metadata.description: Preventing reuse of previous passwords helps ensure that a compromised password is not reused by a user.

criterion.comment: Make sure password reuse setting is set to at least 5 -appears not first.
Make sure password reuse setting is set to at least 5 -appears first.

Tests the for presence of 64bit -S clock_settime and key

the value INACTIVE parameter should be set appropriately in /etc/default/useradd

Tests the for presence of 64bit -S settimeofday and key
ipv6 disabled any modprobe conf file

ind:xmlfilecontent_test.comment: gnome screensaver set to blank screen

tests for reg exp ^[^r][^o][^o][^t].*:0 in /etc/passwd file

unix:file_test.comment: Files referenced in /etc/rsyslog.conf are owned by root

ind:textfilecontent54_test.comment: The password hashing algorithm should be set correctly in /etc/libuser.conf

make sure a password is defined in /boot/grub/grub.conf

unix:sysctl_test.comment: kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.secure_redirects set to 0

check value selinux|enforcing=0 in /boot/grub/grub.conf, fail if found

unix:sysctl_test.comment: kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.log_martians set to 1

ind:textfilecontent54_test.comment: check authfail maximum failed login attempts allowed in /etc/pam.d/password-auth
make sure nullok is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
check for client signing = mandatory in /etc/samba/smb.conf

Ensures system configured to export logs to remote host

unix:sysctl_test.comment: kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route set to 0
kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts set to 1

kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.tcp_syncookies set to 1
